Tasks.Task Description: Identify the goals and requirements for the API Management service, including the APIs to be managed, user access levels, and integration points.
Plan the API structure, including endpoints, methods, and data formats. Define how APIs will interact with backend services and external systems.
Create an API Management instance in the Azure portal, selecting the appropriate pricing tier and region for deployment.
Import or manually define APIs in the API Management service. Set up routes, request/response transformations, and policies.
Apply security measures such as OAuth2, API keys, and IP filtering. Configure rate limiting and quotas to protect APIs from abuse.
Enable and customize the developer portal for API consumers. Provide documentation, testing tools, and subscription management features.
Set up monitoring tools to track API usage, performance, and errors. Integrate with Azure Monitor or third-party analytics platforms.
Perform end-to-end testing of APIs to ensure they function as expected. Validate security policies, data transformations, and backend integrations.
Move APIs from development to production environments. Ensure proper versioning and rollback mechanisms are in place.
Create detailed documentation for the API Management configuration, including policies, endpoints, and security measures.
Train the development and operations teams on using and managing the API Management service. Offer ongoing support for troubleshooting and updates.
Conduct periodic reviews of API configurations, security policies, and performance metrics. Update APIs and policies as needed.
